instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
Hi. So, I have a board here that came in with no backlight, but had full video. I replaced C9020 and C9796 because they looked burnt. Also L9080 was missing completely so I replaced that as well. Turned the laptop on to see if it made a difference and I got a chime with a quick flash from the backlight and no video whatsoever. Just darkness. Started measuring around and this is how far I got before things got worse.

U900 PN 4,5 3.2V
LCD_IG_EN 3.2V

Upon measuring pins 2,3,4 on LVDS voltage started at 3.3 and dropped until I noticed that L9004 had pretty much imploded into a bubble at some point during taking measurements. Right now it looks like it could be welded to the board and C9015, C9010 and L9008 dont look so great either. Thanks for any help in advance. Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
Replace all burned and bad looking parts and check LVDS connector, could be shorted inside, my advice is replace it......

After check all this connect your display, do not plug magsafe yet!!!

Check for short in diode mode on L9004, L9008 and on C9020, if no short found, plug magsafe..........

Report result.....

Thanks again man. Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: So there is a very obvious problem here, tell me which pin is way to low...

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: OK. pn 18. Should be same or close as pin 17. This is causing me to damage screens?

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: So I should i will remove L9080 and check for short in line from pad 1? This line goes to PCH. Thank you.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: remove the inductor and see which side the short is on. Pin 1 or Pin 2.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: Hi. Thank you. It is on Pin 1.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
if its in pin 1 then the shorts going to be in the [B]P[/B]latform [B]C[/B]ontroller [B]H[/B]ub.

That's shitty luck if it is. Be careful with those probes next time.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: Just replace the PCH and fix the ME region. This cannot not damage the LCD in anyway.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
OK... I'll Pray around... Just a few questions first...

1. This is most likely not something I can do with a hot air station. Is there a decent BGA rework station available that you can recommend to carry this out? 
2. The chips I'm finding online are from China and cost 11 bucks. Are these viable chips?
3. Do you have an idea of what is actually causing the damage to the LCD's? Its making me absolutely crazy.

Thanks a lot. Have a good one.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
There is probably no damage to the LCD unless you short out the backlight output to that line with the LCD connected. That could kill the PCH and/or the LCD.

Unless you want to do more BGA rework, spending $1000 on a rework station for just this board makes no sense. Also need to practice first as it is a bit of an art.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message: Farm this out to soneone who does BGA rework. Let them provide the chip. Ive had good results in buying PCH chips. But you'll struggle to make your BGA rework machine pay.

threads.title: 820-3115 No Backlight No Video
threads.message:
Thanks for the response. Though I am definitely interested in doing BGA rework in the future if there is money in it and it becomes more demanding for me I will take your advice and practice with my hot air station. (crawl before you walk type thing)Thanks again Duke. Have a good one.

PS. $1000 for good working station. (more info if you get a chance)

"Gurmon" just saw your response after I posted response. Thank You for your help. To pay someone to do it wouldn't be in my best interest for this board I don't think.  Thanks man.
